actions: Thiamine Pyrophosphate (TPP) coenzyme production
Carbohydrate and amino acid metabolism via TPP
Ethanol convertion to water and carbon dioxide via TPP
Fatty acid and cholesterol formation via TPP
Carbohydrate to fat (storage) conversion via TPP
Acetylcholine formation via Acetyl CoA production
name: Vitamin B1 (Thiamine)

references.credit: The world's healthiest foods, Vitamin B1 - Thiamin
Jennifer J. Otten, Jennifer Pitzi Hellwig, Linda D. Meyers, Editors, 'Dietary Reference Intakes: The Essential Guide to Nutrient Requirements', Vitamins and Minerals, Thiamine
Elson Haas M. MD, Healthy.net, Vitamins: Vitamin B1 -- Thiamine

summary: Vitamin B1 or Thiamine is an essential water-soluble nutrient, hence, it cannot be stored and is easily eliminated from the body through urine or perspiration.
warnings: Degraded by sulfites found in food preservatives
Degraded by thermolabile thiaminases from raw fish and shellfish
Degraded by dry heat cooking
Destroyed by boiling and moist heat cooking
Absorption impaired by caffeic acid from coffee, agan oil, thyme, sage, spearmint
Absorption impaired by chlorogenic acid from Hibiscus, potatoes, flesh of eggplants, peaches, prunes, green coffee, green tea
Absorption impaired by tannic acid from commercial beverages
Absorption impaired by quercitin
Absorption impaired by rutin
Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, stress, fever, pharmaceutical drugs, surgery
Metabolism requires Manganese

actions: Flavin Adenine Dinucleotide (FAD) and Riboflavin Flavin Mononucleotide (FMN) coenzymes production
Hidrogen transportation via FAD and FMN
Carbohydrate and lipid metabolism via FMN and FAD
Vitamin B6 metabolism via FAD and FMN
Retinol (Vitamin A) metabolism via FAD
Tryptophan to vitamin B3 (Niacin) convertion via FAD
Vitamin B9 (Folate) metabolism via FAD
Iron absorption and metabolism
name: Vitamin B2 (Riboflavin)

references.credit: The world's healthiest foods, Vitamin B2 - Thiamin

Elson Haas M. MD, Healthy.net, Vitamins: Vitamin B2 -- Riboflavin

summary: Vitamin B2 or Riboflavin is an essential water-soluble nutrient, hence, it cannot be stored and is easily eliminated from the body through urine or perspiration.
warnings: Destroyed by sunlight
Absorption impaired by excess copper
Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, caffeine, stress, pharmaceutical drugs

actions: Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD) and Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide Phosphate (NADP).
Protein, carbohydrate, lipid, and alcohol metabolism via NAD
Cell signaling via NAD
DNA repair via NAD
Fatty acid and cholesterol formation via NADP
Red blood cell formation via NAD and NADP
Steroid formation via NAD and NADP
name: Vitamin B3 (Niacin)

references.credit: The world's healthiest foods, Vitamin B3 - Niacin

summary: Vitamin B3 or Niacin is an essential water-soluble nutrient, hence, it cannot be stored and is easily eliminated from the body through urine or perspiration.
warnings: Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, caffeine, stress, pharmaceutical drugs, excess water

actions: Coenzyme A (CoA) production
Protein, carbohydrate, and lipid metabolism via CoA
Acetylcholine formation via CoA
Fatty acid, cholesterol, sphingosines, and phospolipid formation via CoA
Adrenal hormone formation via CoA
Steroid formation via CoA
Signal transduction via CoA
Enzyme activation and deactivation via CoA
name: Vitamin B5 (Pantothenic acid)

references.credit: The world's healthiest foods, Pantothenic acid

summary: Vitamin B5 or Pantothenic acid is an essential water-soluble nutrient, hence, it cannot be stored and is easily eliminated from the body through urine or perspiration.
warnings: Destroyed by acids (e.g vinegar) or alkalines (e.g baking soda) and by dry heat cooking
Degraded 33% by cooking
Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, caffeine, stress, pharmaceutical drugs

actions: Pyridoxal-5-phosphate (PLP) coenzyme production
Protein and lipid metabolism via PLP
Choline, Methionine, Serine, Cysteine, Tryptophan, and vitamin B3 (Niacin) formation via PLP
Gamma-Aminobutyric acid (GABA) production via PLP
Arachidonic acid to Prostaglandin E2 conversion via PLP
Glycogen to glucose conversion (glycogenolysis) via PLP
Antibody formation via PLP
Hemoglobin formation via PLP
Norepinephrine, Acetylcholine, Gamma-Aminobutyric acid (GABA), Serotonin, and Histamine formation via PLP
Magnesium, Potassium, and Sodium balance
Gene expression via PLP
name: Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine)

warnings: Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, caffeine, stress, pharmaceutical drugs
Destroyed by sunlight and cooking

actions: Fatty acids, Isoleucine, and Valine formation
Glucose formation (gluconeogenesis)
DNA and RNA formation
deficiencies: Skin rash around eyes, nose, and mouth

warnings: Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, caffeine, stress, pharmaceutical drugs, raw egg whites

actions: Tetrahydrofolic acid (THFA) production
Red blood cell formation via THFA
Antibody formation via THFA
Choline, Methionine, Serine, and Histidine formation via THFA
DNA and RNA formation via THFA

warnings: Absorption impaired by alcohol, sugar, tobacco, caffeine, stress, pharmaceutical drugs
Destroyed by sunlight and cooking
Destroyed by acids

actions: Methylmalonyl-CoA mutase (MUT) and Methionine synthase (MTR) production
Protein, carbohydrate, and lipid metabolism via MUT
Homocysteine balance via MTR
Red blood cell formation via MTR
Iron absorption and metabolism via MTR
DNA and RNA formation via MTR
Choline and Methionine formationv ia MTR
Myelin formation via MUT
